Authors:
Andre Wilson Campos Rosado, Alessandra de Jesus Boari,
Fabio Alex Custodio, Ayane Fernanda Ferreira Quadros, Izabel Cristina
Alves Batista, Olinto Liparini Pereira
Title:
Helminthosporiella stilbacea associated with African oil palm
(Elaeis guineensis) in Brazil
Abstract:
African oil palm (Elaeis guineensis Jacq.) is considered
the most productive oleaginous crop due to its high oil production per
hectare. In April 2015, E. guineensis leaves showing elliptical necrotic
spots with yellowish halo were observed in a commer‐ cial plantation in
Moju, Pará state, Brazil. A synematous fungus was consistently observed
associated with the necrotic spots. The aim of this study was to
identify this fungus associated with E. guineensis in Brazil. Based on
morphology and DNA sequence data of the internal transcribed spacer
rDNA, the fungus was identified as Helminthosporiella stilbacea.
Helmintosporiella stilbacea has been reported associated with leaf spots
on E. guineensis in Africa, Ghana, Sudan and Zambia. To the best of our
knowledge, this is the first report of H. stilbacea associated with E.
guineensis in Brazil.
